website_summaries.verdict: Excellent price point for pucks that work great for indoor and outdoor play.
pros: Smooth puck that slides on the ice well and delivers a realistic game play experience
Will work for either games or practice sessions
Same dimensions and weight as NCAA and NHL pucks for regulation play
cons: Doesn't quite have the grip on the edges as others

customer_reviews.title: Hockey Pucks
customer_reviews.text: These are hockey pucks, they are black and hard (especially after they are on ice). If you suck they make a nice (ding) sound when they hit a post. If you have a backyard rink you may as well buy 24 because you will lose them all in the snow in the first hour. I also used a router on one so that I could use it to protect my pinch welds while jacking up cars. Yes, they smell...they are a solid chunk of rubber...they are not made from flowers or exotic dancers so they will be a bit strong smelling (actually I've smelled a few strippers that smelled worse).
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great and the guys at the shop recharging my AC ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these to build some body mounts for my 2000 ford ranger 2.5. Froze them and center drilled to receive metal sleeves for my new bolts. Worked out great and the guys at the shop recharging my AC were tickled to see an old hot rod trick on a ranger. Per the other reviews, these things STINK to high hell of rubber odor (obviously) . Open them in the garage and put them in ziplok bags if you freeze them.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Jacking Pads
customer_reviews.text: I don't play hockey, but I made a set of jacking pads for my Tesla. They worked great!
customer_reviews.author: NCG

customer_reviews.title: Not the best in terms of durability
customer_reviews.text: For the Price you pay they are okay. I agree the smell is a little strong, but I dont spend time smelling the pucks. Durability wise they need to be better. We play higher tier adult league and these pucks are almost totaled. Some are missing chunks out of them and some are even starting to show signs of cracking. Not sure if we had a bad batch or these arent very durable. Overall for the price they are okay if you are just using them for practice and firing them around.
customer_reviews.author: Jtrem

customer_reviews.title: Great Foundation for Bench Cookies
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as bench cookies: those things you use to elevate work pieces on benches for painting, cutting sanding, etc. I glued a layer of non-skid rubber to the top and the bottom and they work great. The pucks are very solid and have good weight to them for this application. They do have a strong "new rubber" smell as other reviewers have pointed out, but they are in my garage and the smell goes away after a while. The mesh bags they come in are also nice for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Prof CAH

customer_reviews.title: Alternate Use - Hat Hanging with Command Strips
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to hang some of my hats up and these pucks fit the bill. I just attached some Velcro Command Strips on them and voila Hat Hangers! Pucks are a bit heavy for their size, solid and smell like rubber. Comes in a mesh bag.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany D Knox

customer_reviews.title: Black like they should be and made of rubber
customer_reviews.text: I mean they are hockey pucks. They were round in the right places. Black like they should be and made of rubber. Good product
customer_reviews.author: bernedette

customer_reviews.title: My God, IAm Finally a Complete Man😁
customer_reviews.text: I’ve lived in South Beach, Tokyo, New York, England, Los Angeles, Atlanta, Austin, wearing the latest gear at the hottest clubs...I once had an Organic Bacon and Goat Cheese MARTINI in Beverly Hills, $87 and pretty decent...But I always felt like there was something missing...I’ve done Black, White, Brown, the whole rainbow, while ingesting the most expensive party drinks and ‘thingies’....But still, this emptiness....and then I ordered the 18 pack of HOCKEY PUCKS and OOOMMMGGG!!! It’s what I have been looking for all of my life....so hard to go on, the tears are really making a mess of my ridiculously expensive outfit....Just....Just...😂😭🐥...Thanks for listening, May God Bless You with HOCKEY PUCKS In the near future.......
customer_reviews.author: London V.S.

customer_reviews.title: Alternate uses
customer_reviews.text: We don't use these for hockey - but to supplement the pads on vehicle lifts. These fit right in the holes on the lift arms, and are very gentle on those vehicles that might be scuffed or damaged while being picked up with the metal pads. The rubber pad covers from the lift companies are 10X the price of these amazing hockey pucks. This was a total score! :D
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Strong and durable feet
customer_reviews.text: I used these to make 6 feet for a 1000 Lb. elevator that I made for my garage. They were easy to drill and counter sink to clear the 1/2" bolts that I used. They'd probably make great hockey puck as well...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed on first use
customer_reviews.text: My car has those annoying jacking points that are not a flat surface. The old hockey puck I used to use lasted me 7 years. These pucks split in half on the first jack pump. Car wasn't even in the air yet. Don't buy these unless you plan on jacking a car with a flat surface.
customer_reviews.author: Damien

customer_reviews.title: Budget pucks....with an odor
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they're budget hockey pucks. I'm not shooting them with a hockey stick, so I don't know if they hold up as well for that as the league-endorsed brand. But they did come with a strong chemical odor that lasts a long time.
customer_reviews.author: vegasdude

customer_reviews.title: Strong rubber smell
customer_reviews.text: I'm not using these for ice hockey, but as non-slip bench cookies, so no idea how they perform on ice, but they work great on my workbench. They had an extremely strong chemical smell. The mesh bag seems durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry010101

customer_reviews.title: They're Pucks...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for ice hockey practices, where pucks are definitely a commodity. They work great for what they are: nothing outstanding, just a bunch of practice pucks. The mesh bags they come in are less than stellar, so plan on storing them in something else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: price is high
customer_reviews.text: These were the cheapest pucks I could find but worked for the table decorations we made just really did not want to spend so much money for one day decorations
customer_reviews.author: wanda Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Used as body lift for my Early ford Bronco
customer_reviews.text: I used these as a 1" body lift for my 1972 From Bronco. I already had replaced body mounts a few years back. Just needed an extra 1" to make clearance for some modification.
customer_reviews.author: LARRY CRIDER JR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect use for my garage lift
customer_reviews.text: I use these to put between my lift arms to lift corvettes and other low vehicles. Also work great for jack pads. Solid and high quality!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Sponsel

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Faswin Hockey Pucks are amazing from beginner to pro. They are a great quality for the money. They even come in a mesh bag to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron King

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: They are made from China but they are real quality hockey pucks. I'm an auto tech and I use these to lift vehicles that are lower than nornal. Great set for the price. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: XCLR8

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for lifts
customer_reviews.text: Have been using these as automotive lift spacers. Would also recommend for your jack or jackstands. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Good molding, but they stink
customer_reviews.text: Good molding, but they stink. Leave them outside for a while. They make good heavy-duty machine feet. They drill nicely, and even handle outdoor use.
customer_reviews.author: BrendaEM

customer_reviews.title: Official puck comparison
customer_reviews.text: Comparison with ‘Official’ Czech-made pucks, same size and weight. Haven’t used on the ice yet, they do have a slick glossy finish on the tops.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Great Practice Pucks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my grandsons for Christmas, so they can take more practice shots in the garage without the need to constantly retrieve pucks. They do the job well, and are holding up to daily use. Excellent value compared to the prices at the rink's pro shop.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy ToesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: To place on a floor jack to raise my Porsche. I did not use the pucks for their intended purpose of playing hockey.
customer_reviews.author: Bob ground

customer_reviews.title: Standard pucks
customer_reviews.text: Basic hockey pucks. Works well to keep my metal items off the garage floor and rusting.
customer_reviews.author: Chester copperpot

customer_reviews.title: Good luck quality
customer_reviews.text: Great pucks. We use them for shooting practice on synthetic ice in the garage. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: 2sD

customer_reviews.title: Budget pucks
customer_reviews.text: They're pucks, they're the cheapest price per puck available currently on Amazon. They smell like cigarette smoke. They're very shiny on the top/bottom surfaces, and about 1-1.5mm shorter than the bucket of 'official' pucks I've got. And they came in 3 weird mini drawstring bags instead of one bigger drawstring. But I can dangle and slap em all the way to beer league D.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H.

customer_reviews.title: 12 pucks
customer_reviews.text: Black pucks. Good quality, strong smell. I left them outside for 2 months to air out because I am using them under my 70 lb. tower speakers on hardwood floors. They work as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Devener

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Pucks
customer_reviews.text: Why the puck did I buy these pucks, not for hockey. They work real well as machine feet to stop that annoying floor vibrations when the mill or lathe are running.
customer_reviews.author: J&J

customer_reviews.title: A buck a puck
customer_reviews.text: Use eight pucks to raise corvettes does the jobs well. Does not slip or crack sturdy solid smells like rubber yum yum
customer_reviews.author: bruce neander

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for money
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome!, great value for money, just what I needed to practice in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: GV

customer_reviews.title: Used for car jack pads for Model 3
customer_reviews.text: More than enough hardness for use with Quick jack for lifting Tesla Model 3. No damage to the side sills nor mattery pack.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for what I sued them for
customer_reviews.text: Used these for wheels on fake roller blades I made for a costume. Came out perfectly.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: Craft project that I haven't started yet but think they will work great.

customer_reviews.text: Used to mount air compressor to shop floor. Lot cheaper than installation kit.

customer_reviews.title: Good

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the workroom
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my workroom and they have held up great. Used them to change the pitch on some camping chairs.

customer_reviews.title: Bump stops
customer_reviews.text: Used them for bumb stops for the spare tire on my Jeep Wrangler. Worked like a charm. No crazy smells just solid rubber like I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Downes

customer_reviews.title: Jack pucks
customer_reviews.text: Used for jack pads, have stacked 4 high on occasion.

customer_reviews.title: They're hockey pucks
customer_reviews.text: Used them for my automotive lift but I'm sure they'd work well on ice too.

customer_reviews.title: Work great for bump stops in coil springs.
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat for the price. Made bump stops for jeep with these. Very durable.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: These work great as homebrew bump stops on my 99, 2000, and 97 cherokees

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Used them to lift up a 1200 LB safe of a concrete floor. They seem to be holding up extremely well.

customer_reviews.title: If you go through hockey pucks like my kids do
customer_reviews.text: If you go through hockey pucks like my kids do, you can never have enough. And The Price is Right for these!

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Garbage
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE!!! They are cheap knockoffs and start to chip and come apart after their first use. I REPEAT DO NOT BUY!!!

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. Bags are helpful.
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely hockey pucks. Not a lot to review about them. They came in two separate mesh carrying bags with 6 pucks in each bag. The bag is helpful to keep my pucks from getting lost in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Great price for 12 pucks
customer_reviews.text: Great price for 12 pucks. As others have said they have a strong rubber oder you might want to consider when thinking about where you are going to store them. They are high quality and work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Plant basin risers
customer_reviews.text: Yep don't play hockey but needed a system to raise heavy potted plants off ground for drainage.....voila !

customer_reviews.title: they're good.
customer_reviews.text: Hey, it's a hockey puck...I'm actually using them for mounting equipment. For that, they're good.

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect. I use them for yard art
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect. I use them for yard art. My boyfriend drills a hole half way up into puck, then they are glued to back of yard art and mounted on rebar.

customer_reviews.title: Hockey Pucks can be used for than just playing hockey
customer_reviews.text: I use these pucks as a base for displaying beautiful depression glass in my gardens. They are extremely durable in both extreme heat and cold. I drill a hole in the puck, insert a steel rod and glue the decorative glass to the puck with Epoxy glue.

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: My son shoots pucks all day long and wanted extra.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great pucks for the price. Been using them in the Garage to hit against a tarp and they are holding up nicely. Did smell a bit on first opening, but not as bad as some others described.

customer_reviews.title: These are Chinese made
customer_reviews.text: Cheap chinese junk. Spend a little more money and buy real slovakian pucks.

customer_reviews.title: Make great bench dogs
customer_reviews.text: Using as bench dogs - glued on some tool drawer lining and they stay in place great

customer_reviews.title: perfect to use as lift pucks
customer_reviews.text: We use these as lifting pucks on our post lifts. works great!

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: These feel exactly like what is at every hockey rink
customer_reviews.text: These feel exactly like what is at every hockey rink. Has the grooves like any other puck. New pucks have a distinctive smell, so you may want to order separately or with items you don't mind a rubber smell for awhile.

customer_reviews.text: Pucks are great for separating high end sound system components for air circulation, durable non-slip feet for metal sculptures, non-scratch risers for outdoor potted plants etc.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Work as well as any pucks my kids and husband have used. The kids use them at home on the synthetic shooting pad and also on the ice for practice. My husband uses them when coaching. Definitely a good buy.

customer_reviews.title: i am using them on a craft project to hold plates onto rebar and they work great.

product_meta.title: Faswin 18 Pack Classic Ice Hockey Puck with 3 Reusable Mesh Bag
feature_bullets: Case of 18 Black Official Hockey Pucks with 3 Reusable Mesh Bag
Pond Hockey or On the Rink
Vulcanized Rubber.Remarkable flatness, hardness and smooth surface quality for consistent, powerful and accurate shots and passes
Play with the puck the pros use; NHL official size and weight: 3" diameter, 1" thick, 166 grams
